short_summary: New Marginal Wharf and Breakwater Structure 403, Petit-Cap, Westmorland County, N.B. This project is located at the Petit-Cap Harbour, Westmorland County, New Brunswick.
description: Demolition and reconstruction of structure 403, on the quai marginale and brise-lame project at Petit-Cap Harbour, Westmorland County, New Brunswick. Scope of work includes environmental controls, dredging of the harbour basin, construction of a new Berlin Wall marginal wharf, partial demolition of existing structure 403 and necessities for interior space.
full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement**
# New Marginal Wharf and Breakwater Structure 403 Project
## Location
Petit-Cap, Westmorland County, New Brunswick

## Project Overview
This tender announcement invites interested suppliers to submit a bid for the construction of a new Marginal Wharf and Breakwater Structure 403 in Petit-Cap, New Brunswick.

## Important Details
* **Reference Number**: PW-PWJ-017-6251
* **Amendment Number**: 2
* **Solicitation Number**: EC015-230487/A
* **Publication Date**: September 1, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date**: October 4, 2022, at 13:00:00
* **Estimated Cost**: between $1,000,001 and $5,000,000 (HST excluded)

## Description of Work
The project entails the demolition and re-construction of Structure 403, a Berlin Wall Marginal Wharf, at the Petit-Cap Harbour, Westmorland County, New Brunswick. Key elements of the project include:

* Demolition of the existing structure
* Construction of a new Berlin Wall Marginal Wharf
* Installation of electrical services
* Partial demolition of the existing breakwater
* Site cleanup and removal of environmental controls and cofferdam

## Contract Documents
The contract documents outline the terms and conditions of the project, including the structures' environmental considerations, regulations, and constraints during construction. Suppliers must comply with such documents and regulations.

## Standing Offer Conditions
* Trade Agreement: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Tendering Procedure: All interested suppliers may submit a bid
* Competitive Procurement: Lowest/Lower Bid
* Contract Security: Standard bid and contract security is required for construction
* Delivery Date: As specified in the contract documents

## Inquiry and Submission Requirements
All inquiries and questions must be submitted in writing to Sonia Stockman, Contractual Authority, via email at sonia.stockman@pwgsc.gc.ca or by telephone at (506) 961-7412. Such inquiries must be made no less than 5 business days prior to the tender closing date.

## Languages
This procurement is governed by the Official Languages Act, and documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. Suppliers are encouraged to submit documents in the language of their preference.

Note: As you only have 400 words to work with, I omitted some details like those related to NIBS, Contracting Entity
